metadata.title: Special Inspection Requirements — Types, Triggers, and Qualified Inspectors
metadata.source: SF Building Inspection Commission Code (SFBICC) Section 1701-1706, CBC Chapter 17, AB-046
notes: Special inspections are required in addition to regular DBI inspections for specific construction activities
Special inspectors must be approved by DBI and are hired/paid by the building owner
Special inspection reports must be filed with DBI before final inspection approval
Failure to obtain required special inspections can result in stop-work order and permit revocation
Statement of Special Inspections (SSI) form required at plan check for projects requiring special inspections

general_triggers: Structural steel construction (all welded or bolted connections)
Cast-in-place concrete (footings, slabs, walls, columns, beams)
Wood construction with engineered connections (hold-downs, shear walls)
Soils and foundations (deep foundations, ground improvement)
Special moment frames and braced frames
when_required.cost_threshold: Generally required for projects with structural work regardless of cost
exemptions: Work of a minor nature per Building Official determination
Construction using conventional light-frame wood per CBC Section 2308 (some inspections still required)
Projects where the Building Official determines special inspection is not needed based on scope

activities_requiring_inspection: Welding (all types: complete joint penetration, partial, fillet)
Steel fabrication shop operations (when required by engineer of record)
structural_steel.qualified_inspector: AWS Certified Welding Inspector (CWI) for welding; ICC Special Inspector for bolting
structural_steel.frequency: Continuous for welding of primary structural members; periodic for bolting
structural_steel.documentation: Daily inspection reports, NDT (ultrasonic, radiographic) test results for CJP welds

activities_requiring_inspection: Reinforcing steel placement (size, spacing, cover, lap splices, ties)
Concrete placement (slump testing, air content, temperature)
concrete.qualified_inspector: ACI Concrete Field Testing Technician Level I or ICC Special Inspector
concrete.frequency: Continuous during concrete placement; periodic for reinforcement inspection
concrete.documentation: Concrete mix design approval, cylinder break reports (7-day and 28-day), rebar inspection reports

activities_requiring_inspection: Mortar and grout proportioning and mixing
masonry.frequency: Continuous for grouting operations; periodic for unit placement
masonry.documentation: Mortar/grout compressive strength test results, prism test results

activities_requiring_inspection: Metal connector hardware installation (hold-downs, straps, ties)
Engineered wood products installation (glulam, LVL, I-joists)
wood_construction.frequency: Periodic — typically at critical connection points before concealment
wood_construction.documentation: Connection verification reports, nail pattern verification

activities_requiring_inspection: Soil verification during excavation (bearing capacity confirmation)
Grade beam and mat foundation placement
Ground improvement (soil nails, micropiles, jet grouting)
soils_and_foundations.qualified_inspector: Licensed Geotechnical Engineer or Certified Soils Special Inspector
soils_and_foundations.frequency: Continuous during pile driving; periodic during excavation and fill
soils_and_foundations.documentation: Geotechnical reports, pile driving logs, compaction test results, bearing verification

activities_requiring_inspection: Reinforcing bar welding (tack welds prohibited without engineering approval)
Metal stud welding to structural elements
welding.documentation: Welder certifications (WPS/PQR), daily welding inspection reports

activities_requiring_inspection: Patching after damage from other trades
fire_resistant_materials.frequency: Periodic — at start of each application area and random sampling
fire_resistant_materials.documentation: Thickness measurements, adhesion/cohesion test results, manufacturer compliance

smoke_control.qualified_inspector: Qualified mechanical engineer or ICC-certified special inspector
smoke_control.documentation: Commissioning report, test results, system documentation for Fire Department

seismic_systems.qualified_inspector: Varies by system — typically structural steel or concrete special inspector
seismic_systems.frequency: Continuous for critical connections; periodic for anchorage
seismic_systems.documentation: Connection inspection reports, device certification, test results

who_can_perform.approval_authority: SF Department of Building Inspection (Building Official)
requirements: Must be approved by DBI prior to performing inspections
Must hold relevant ICC certification or professional license
Must demonstrate competency in the specific type of inspection
Must be independent of the contractor performing the work (conflict of interest prohibition)

common_certifications.certification: ICC Structural Steel and Bolting Special Inspector

common_certifications.covers: Wood connections, shear walls, engineered wood
Concrete sampling and testing (cylinders, slump, air)
Soils verification, foundation inspection, pile driving

who_can_perform.hiring: Owner is responsible for hiring and paying special inspectors. Cost is not part of permit fees.
who_can_perform.liability: Special inspector is liable for the accuracy of their inspections and reports

statement_of_special_inspections.when_required: Must be submitted at plan check for all projects requiring special inspections
statement_of_special_inspections.prepared_by: Registered Design Professional (architect or engineer of record)
contents: List of all required special inspections by type
Identification of qualified special inspection agencies
Schedule of inspections (when in construction sequence)

final_report.title: Final Report of Special Inspections
final_report.must_state: All required special inspections have been completed and all work was found to be in compliance
final_report.signed_by: Special inspector(s) and registered design professional

sf_specific_requirements.seismic_retrofit: Soft-story retrofit (AB-083) and UMB retrofit programs have specific special inspection requirements defined in the retrofit standards
sf_specific_requirements.high_rise: High-rise buildings (75+ ft) have enhanced special inspection requirements per SFBC amendments
sf_specific_requirements.historic_buildings: Work on Article 10/11 buildings may require additional inspection coordination with historic preservation staff
sf_specific_requirements.ab_046: AB-046 provides DBI-specific guidance on special inspection administration and reporting requirements
